se.code77.jq

Class JQ.Deferred<V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.code77.jq.JQ.Deferred<V>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - Type of the value carried by the promise
    Enclosing class:
    JQ

    public static final class JQ.Deferred<V>
extends java.lang.Object
    A deferred object is used by methods implementing asynchronous operations exposed by promises. Whereas the Promise object itself only offers means of observing the Promise's state, deferred is the object on which implementation actually resolves or rejects the promise. A deferred object can be achieved in one of two ways:
    1. Calling JQ.defer() returns a Deferred object. The method will return promise and start the task producing the result to be resolved. Once the result is completed or failed, resolve(Object) or reject(Exception) will be called, respectively.
    2. Calling JQ.defer(DeferredHandler) works similar to 1) but offers a quicker way of creating a Deferred object and returning the promise for it in one operation, while defining the task to be run in a supplied JQ.DeferredHandler.
